sections.section_instructions:
Choose the correct letter A, B, C or D.
Write the correct letter in boxes 27-32 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: Why is it difficult to find mite harvestmen?

options.A: they are too small to see with naked eye.
options.B: they can easily be confused with daddy longlegs.
options.C: they are hard to distinguish from their surroundings.
options.D: they do not exist in large numbers in any one place.

questions.question_text: Why are mite harvestmen of interest to Dr Giribet and his colleagues?

options.A: they have been studied far less than most other species.
options.B: they show the effects of climate on the evolution of animals.
options.C: they have an unusual relationship with plants and other animals.
options.D: they provide evidence relating to a field of study other than insects.

questions.question_text: What factor contributed to Wegener’s idea that present-day continents used to form a single landmass?

options.A: changes in the level of the ocean
options.B: the distance that species could travel
options.C: the lack of certain fossils on one side of the Atlantic
options.D: similarities in living conditions on both sides of the Atlantic

questions.question_text: What point is made by the reference to armadillos?

options.A: regions have both separated and become connected.
options.B: certain animals could travel longer distances than others.
options.C: the oldest species of animals are likely to be found in Africa.
options.D: there is a tendency for animals to spread in a particular direction.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is stated in the fifth paragraph?

options.A: Hawaii is a habitat that cannot support large birds.
options.B: Hawaii is an attractive habitat for certain species of birds.
options.C: flightless birds are more likely to become extinct than others.
options.D: the Hawaiian goose became flightless after it had reached Hawaii.

questions.question_text: Why is evidence from cockroaches of limited value?

options.C: they are found in too few places.
options.D: they have divided into too many species.

content.paragraph:
Some of the first creatures to live on land were the {37} of mite harvestmen.
Boyer, Giribet and others study differences in the {38} of these insects, and trace the development of a number of {39} of the species.
Their evolution appears to reflect changes in the location of {40}.
For example, the same type of mite harvestman is found in places that are now far apart but used to form Gondwana, part of a huge landmass.
